question: Question_11_(a)
statement:
Let

\[\displaystyle
A = \begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 & 2\\
1 & -1 & 1\\
1 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\]

Find a nonzero vector $\displaystyle \vec{v}$ such that
$\displaystyle A\vec{v} = 2\vec{v}$
sols:
To find a nonzero vector v such that Av = 2v, let v = $[a, b, c]^{T}$,
we have $\begin{matrix}
Av = 2v\\ 
\begin{bmatrix}
1 &0 &2 \\ 
1 &-1 &1 \\ 
1 &0 &0 
\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}
a\\ 
b\\ 
c
\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}
2a\\ 
2b\\ 
2c
\end{bmatrix}
\end{matrix}$

Therefore, we can get $\begin{matrix}
a + 2c = 2a\\ 
a - b + c = 2b\\ 
a = 2c
\end{matrix}$ solving for the system, we get a = 2c, c = b, and so a =
2b.

Thus, the nonzero vector v = $\begin{pmatrix}
2\\ 
1\\ 
1
\end{pmatrix}$
